result.execSummary:
The defendant Charles L Belcour was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take >$500 - $5000), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Defendant IS eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program
Defendant IS eligible for the Substance Abuse Program
23 days sentence credit

superMiscConds.notes:
Follow through with any AODA treatment recommended by agent

Follow all rules of Department of Corrections

Court costs are waived. DNA surcharge is to be paid as a condition of extended supervision

Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department. 

If Probation/Extended Supervision is revoked and/or a prison term ordered, outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collections may include income assignment.

with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

1:53 PM Defendant Charles L Belcour in court.  Attorney Angela Wang in court for Charles L Belcour.  Prosecuting attorney Christian Farina in court for the State of Wisconsin.
Case called for plea and sentencing. 
Court conducts plea colloquy.  Defendant enters a plea of no contest to Count 1,  Court finds defendant guilty.  
Recommendations by the State.  Recommendations by the Defense.  Statement by defendant.

The Court Orders the Following:

Count 1:
2 Years Imprisonment (Credit - 23 days)
-	1 Years of Initial Confinement
-	1 Years of Extended Supervision

Defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program
Defendant is eligible for the Substance Abuse Program

Conditions of Extended Supervision:
-	Follow through with any AODA treatment recommended by Agent;
-	Follow all rules of Department of Corrections;

COSTS:  waived

DNA Surcharge: $ 250.00

DNA Sample ordered and to be provided immediately if in custody or within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department. 

Total costs/fine/forfeiture:  to be paid during term of imprisonment and during extended supervision. Failure to pay;  will result in a civil judgment.

Felony warnings, immigration warnings, voting rights and firearms warnings given.
Filed by Atty. Wang requesting to have the 10/5/2022 status hearing converted to plea and sentencing and if that is not possible the matter adjourned to a new date for plea and sentencing.
Hearing on October 5, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

1:56 PM Defendant Charles L Belcour in court, in custody.  Attorney Andrew Herbers Jr. in court for Attorney Angela Wang for Charles L Belcour. District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin by Julian Marrufo. The State is asking for some cash bail. Attorney Herbers makes statements regarding the defendant's non-appearance and would ask for the signature bond to be reinstated.
Hearing scheduled for October 5, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
WCS Pre-trial Report

1:49 PM; Case called for Plea/sentencing hearing. Prosecuting attorney Peter Michael Tempelis in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Charles L Belcour not in court.  Attorney Angela Wang in court for Charles L Belcour.  Atty. Wang advises she attempted to call her client but was not successful and does not know why he has not appeared today.  State requests a capias.  Court inquires if there are any previous missed court appearances.  Atty. Wang notes her client was previously in custody, so no.  Court will issue a capias and order bail be forfeited.
Ext Code #3
Effective August 1, 2022, this case is assigned to Branch 7 Judicial Vacancy, pursuant to 22-SO-04(67).
Plea/sentencing hearing on August 29, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

09:06 AM; Case called for Hearing.  Defendant Charles L Belcour in court by Zoom video means, in custody Jefferson Co. Jail/Huber, with attorney Angela Wang.    District Attorney's Office Law Intern Abigail Kincheloe appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  All parties have agreed that some may have the hearing conducted remotely. This hearing has met the statutory standards for video conferencing.  Atty. Wang provides an update, she is requesting a plea and sentencing date at the end of August.  Court adjourns for plea and sentencing.  Court confirms as the defendant is at Huber the court will not need to prepare an OTP for the next court date, and the defendant is advised he has to appear in person.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 29, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Hearing on June 10, 2022 at 09:00 am.

10:39 AM Defendant Charles L Belcour in court by zoom video, in custody at the Jefferson County Jail with attorney Angela Wang by zoom video.   Abbey Nickolie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  The Court finds that the Defendants waiver to a preliminary hearing is knowing and voluntary.  Waive reading of Information.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.  Clerk's office to set up video appearance from Jefferson County Jail for the next date.  Hearing scheduled for June 10, 2022 at 09:00 am.
